episodeTitle: The Straw Hat Pirates are the Culprits? The Protectors of the City of Water!
description: The Galley-La Company battles Luffy while accusing Robin and a masked man of attacking Iceburg. Franky reacts to losing his opponent. Sanji and Chopper warn Usopp about the approaching Aqua Laguna storm. Luffy infiltrates the Galley-La building to confront Iceburg, who tearfully demands that Luffy bring Robin to him.

events.title: First Cold Opening in One Piece
events.description: Episode 239 debuts the first cold opening teaser in the One Piece anime series. This format change introduces a brief scene before the opening theme, which becomes a standard feature of the series going forward.
events.significance: Marks a significant production format change for the One Piece anime that would continue for the rest of the series. This cold opening format helps with pacing and viewer engagement.

events.title: Robin Accused of Attacking Iceburg
events.description: Paulie reveals that Iceburg identified two people who attacked him: a tall man with a mask and Nico Robin. This revelation shocks the Straw Hats and puts them at odds with Galley-La Company.
events.significance: This false accusation against Robin is a pivotal moment that drives the conflict of the Water 7 arc and eventually leads to Robin's departure from the crew and the revelation of CP9's involvement.

quotes.text: Iceburg explained that two people attacked him: a tall man with a mask and the other being Nico Robin.
quotes.speaker: Paulie
quotes.context: Paulie explaining to the Straw Hats who attacked Iceburg

events.title: Galley-La Foremen vs Luffy
events.description: Kaku, Paulie, Rob Lucci, Lulu, and Tilestone attack Luffy, declaring the Straw Hats wanted dead or alive. Kaku cuts Luffy's face, Paulie traps him with ropes, Lucci swings a saw, and Tilestone fires a cannon at him.
events.significance: This battle showcases the Galley-La foremen working together against Luffy, not yet knowing that Kaku and Lucci are undercover CP9 agents. The irony is that the real attackers are fighting alongside the innocent.

quotes.text: Luffy and the rest of the Straw Hats are wanted: dead or alive.
quotes.speaker: Kaku
quotes.context: Kaku declaring Luffy wanted after cutting his face

quotes.text: There is no place to run or hide.
quotes.speaker: Paulie

events.title: Franky's Exhaustion from Coup de Vent
events.description: Franky is shown exhausted after using his Coup de Vent attack. His hair is limp, indicating his depleted energy. He declares he will chase after Luffy again once he is recharged, expressing frustration at having his opponent stolen.
events.significance: Demonstrates the energy cost of Franky's powerful Coup de Vent attack and establishes his rivalry with Luffy. This also hints at Franky's cola-powered system.

quotes.text: My Coup de Vent exhausted me and my hair is a sign of this. I promise to chase after Luffy again once I am recharged.
quotes.speaker: Franky

events.title: Aqua Laguna Warning
events.description: Paulie explains that the Aqua Laguna, an incredibly high tide, is approaching Water 7. He states there are only two ways to leave the city before it hits: by ship or by the next Sea Train. Sanji and Chopper rush to warn Usopp about the impending natural disaster.
events.significance: The Aqua Laguna becomes a crucial time constraint for the Water 7 arc's events and plays a major role in the climactic battles. It also showcases Water 7's unique geography and the dangers of living in a water city.

quotes.text: The Aqua Laguna is going to hit soon and there are only two ways you could leave Water 7: by your ship or by the next Sea Train.
quotes.speaker: Paulie
quotes.context: Paulie warning about the approaching Aqua Laguna

events.title: Nami Escapes Using Headbutt
events.description: In an anime-only scene, Nami escapes from a man holding her by headbutting him. This demonstrates her resourcefulness and determination to navigate the dangerous situation in Water 7.
events.significance: Shows Nami's physical capabilities and willingness to fight when necessary, even without her usual weapons. This is an anime-original addition that expands on her character.

events.title: Luffy Infiltrates Galley-La to See Iceburg
events.description: Luffy and Nami make it to Galley-La Company headquarters, noticing shipwrights acting as guards. Luffy bursts through a window to gain entry. Kalifa notices Luffy but allows him to get into Iceburg's room while informing the shipwrights that Luffy hasn't been around.
events.significance: This moment shows Luffy's determination to get answers and Kalifa's manipulation as she secretly allows him through while appearing loyal to Galley-La. This is one of many hints at Kalifa's true allegiance to CP9.

events.title: Iceburg's Emotional Request to See Robin
events.description: Luffy confronts Iceburg in his room. Iceburg thanks Luffy for saving him from the shipwrights and knows Luffy isn't there to murder him. When Luffy demands to hear Iceburg's side of the story, Iceburg confirms that Nico Robin was one of the culprits who attacked him. Tearfully, Iceburg says he wants to see Robin one more time.
events.significance: This is a pivotal emotional moment that deepens the mystery around Robin's actions and Iceburg's motivations. Iceburg's tearful request suggests there's more to the story than a simple assassination attempt, hinting at the larger conspiracy involving the Pluton blueprints and CP9.

themes.description: The episode explores the theme of trust as the Straw Hats are accused of attacking Iceburg, and Robin is specifically named as one of the attackers. The crew must grapple with trusting Robin despite the evidence against her.
themes.symbolism: The masked attacker represents hidden identities and deception, foreshadowing the CP9 reveal.

themes.description: The approaching Aqua Laguna creates a ticking clock for the characters, adding urgency to their need to resolve the situation and escape Water 7.
themes.symbolism: The Aqua Laguna represents the overwhelming forces of nature and the limited time the crew has to uncover the truth.

themes.description: The episode builds on the mystery of who really attacked Iceburg, with Kaku and Lucci fighting against Luffy while being the actual perpetrators. This dramatic irony creates tension for viewers who know more than the characters.
themes.symbolism: The shipwrights guarding Iceburg unknowingly harbor the true attackers among them.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows his determination to understand what happened and protect his crew, refusing to believe Robin would betray them without reason.
keyActions: Confronts Iceburg to learn the truth
quotes: (Demanding to hear Iceburg's side of the story)

characterSpotlights.development: Despite being attacked, Iceburg shows complexity in his emotions toward Robin, tearfully requesting to see her one more time, hinting at deeper motivations.
quotes: I want to see Robin one more time.

characterSpotlights.development: Though not physically present, Robin's actions and motivations become the central mystery of the episode.
Franky's frustration at losing his fight with Luffy shows his competitive nature and hints at his future relationship with the Straw Hats.

mangaDifferences.difference: Nami escaping a captor by headbutting him is an anime-only scene not present in the manga.
The cold opening format is an anime-only production change.

trivia.fact: This is the first One Piece episode to feature a cold opening teaser before the opening theme, a format that would become standard for the series going forward.
Episode 239 aired on July 31, 2005 in Japan, during the height of the Water 7 arc's popularity.
The dramatic irony of Kaku and Lucci fighting Luffy while being the actual attackers of Iceburg wouldn't be revealed to viewers until several episodes later.
Kokoro no Chizu, the opening song, was the first One Piece opening to be aired in widescreen format.
